info.title: API Documentation
info.description: The AlliedOffsets API is a comprehensive data overview of the voluntary carbon market â€“ now, in a handy API format! It contains three key components: - Project-level information ðŸŒ³ - Credit-level information ðŸ’³ - Advanced document search ðŸ—ƒ Project-level endpoints allow users to identify information about a single project or multiple projects. The queries return data points including: project ID, name, registry, sector, location, estimated price, vintage issuances / retirements, and much more. Users can filter projects by registry, location, type, name, and specific registry ID, among others. Credit-level information queries return data on retirement transactions. Users can filter through retirements by project, sector, country, and more. Users can also filter by keyword, which searches through both the â€˜Account Holderâ€™ data, and â€˜Retirement Detailsâ€™ data. Advanced document search allows users to find more detailed information about projects by scanning through their project design documents (as well as other related documents). We have digitized the text of 5,000+ documents (from Verra and Gold Standard) to date, meaning keywords or phrases can be searched across all of those projects. We have also extracted structured data (i.e., tables) from 350+ documents, meaning you can filter through and extract that data, as well. Incase you forget your password and your credential is email based, you can reset your password here

geoEligible.title: GEO Eligibility
geoEligible.description:
The Global Emissions Offset futures (GEO) contract is a physically settled contract that allows for 
        delivery of CORSIA eligible voluntary carbon offset credits from three registries: Verified Carbon 
        Standard (VCS), American Carbon Registry (ACR), and Climate Action Reserve (CAR).

ngeoEligible.title: NGEO Eligibility
ngeoEligible.description:
"The N-GEOÂ® provides companies with a streamlined way to meet emissions-reductions
        targets using offsets sourced exclusively from Agriculture, Forestry,
        and Other Land Use (AFOLU) projects.

sdgeoEligible.title: SDGEO Eligibility
sdgeoEligible.description:
The SD-GEO provides the market with a standardised contract that
        streamlines transactions of cookstove credits from the Verra Registry and
        Gold Standard registry, comprising high-quality cookstove projects that meet 
        at least five of the United Nation's Sustainable Development Goals.

cgeoEligible.title: CGEO Eligibility
cgeoEligible.description:
The C-GEO contract design incorporates many of the best elements of CBLâ€™s GEO and N-GEO contract specifications 
        to enhance the contractâ€™s reliability as a benchmark, optimize the underlying high-quality credit supply to 
        maximize liquidity and price discovery, and streamline and minimize operational requirements. The C-GEO 
        contracts are identical except for the initial vintage ranges they cover and how the ranges change over time.

cnxEligible.title: CIX Nature X Eligibility
cnxEligible.description:
CIX Nature X is a benchmark price assessment representing the daily spot traded value in the voluntary carbon 
        market of recent vintages of nature-based carbon credits from well-established global projects.

corsiaPhases.title: CORSIA Phases
corsiaPhases.description:
The Carbon Offsetting and Reduction Scheme for International Aviation (CORSIA) is the world's first mandatory 
        sector-specific compliance carbon pricing scheme. CORSIA Eligible Emissions Units are credits identified in the 
        ICAO document 'Corsia Eligible Emission Unit' through specific requirements. CORSIA's Pilot Phase considers 
        offsetting activity between 2021 and 2023, while CORSIA's First Phase goes from 2024 to 2026.

type.description: Method by which alert is sent, possible values: email, slack

accelerators.title: Accelerators
accelerators.description: Accelerators provide early stage support: financing, business model assistance, networking opportunities, and more. Given that CDR is a fledgling industry, their support is crucial in helping new companies get off the ground.

organisations.title: Organisations
organisations.description: Industry Organisations bring together suppliers, marketplaces, investors, research institutions, buyers of credits, and others to promote the CDR industry.
